title: The matching H.C.F. of two numbers is 13. If these two numbers are in the ratio of 16:10, then what are the numbers? - Quora

response.answer_text: 104 and 65 Ratio of numbers = 16:10 = 8:5 Say, the numbers are 8x and 5x Here, x has to be their HCF because any other number in place of x would change the HCF. You can try this out by taking a few examples. So, the numbers are 8*13 and 5*13, that is, 104 and 65.
The matching H.C.F. of two numbers is 13. If these two numbers are in the ratio of 16:10, then what are the numbers? Solution: The numbers are 13*16 or 208 and 13*10 or 130. Answer.
